text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The candidate answer explicitly addresses the unitary risk of the EUTM in Section 2.1 under 'Centralised opposition & cancellation,' stating: 'One opposition period (3\u2009months, extendable to 6\u2009months) and one cancellation/invalidity proceeding for the whole territory.' It further reinforces this concept in Section 2.2 under 'Separate opposition/cancellation proceedings,' contrasting it with national filings where 'you may have to defend the mark in several jurisdictions simultaneously.' This directly confirms the unitary nature of the EUTM system where a single successful challenge affects the entire registration.", "criterion_id": "6a8aefcc-2c31-4875-a0b5-35b56ce837f0"}
